item.title: The Rise & Speak Experience
item.description:
119 Florence Ave.
Grass Valley, CA 95945
Tuesday, October 7, 2025, 6 – 8:30pm



Are you ready to turn your life story into a message that moves hearts and minds?

Type of Event: Community, Conference / Lecture / Workshop
Other location: Sierra Center for Spiritual Living
City/Area: Grass Valley
Price: $260 (payment plans available), $60 deposit required to hold your spot
Age range: Adult
Event details: The Sierra Center for Spiritual Living is proud to host the Rise & Speak Experience, a transformative 7-week public speaking workshop designed to help participants uncover their life’s defining moments and craft messages that uplift, inspire, and educate.Created and facilitated by Mitch Austin, a certified Master Storyteller with over 15 years of public speaking experience, this immersive journey guides participants through a process of personal reflection, storytelling mastery, and stage presence. The program culminates in a live performance night where students share their heartfelt messages with a supportive audience.What Participants Will Gain:A powerful, personal message rooted in life experienceStorytelling techniques and public speaking skillsConfidence and tools to manage stage frightA sense of community and deep connectionA safe, affirming space for healing and growthEach participant receives one-on-one coaching with Mitch and completes guided homework to support message development. The final performance offers a chance to share their story with a loving and enthusiastic audience.Registration Required: To reserve your spot, email office@sierracenter.org or call (530) 274-1018. Space is limited to ensure personalized attention."I was so elevated. I knew it wasn’t heaven, but it had to be in the same zip code." — Kathy S., Rise & Speak graduateLet your story rise. Let your voice speak. Join us for the Rise & Speak Experience.Important Information:Please park in the rear of the Veteran’s Memorial building located at 255 S. Auburn Street, Grass Valley, and use the footpath to the Center. About Sierra Center for Spiritual Living:Sierra Center is a diverse and welcoming community. We engage in practices that uplift the spirit, deepen awareness and activate compassion for ourselves, each other, and the world. Wherever you are on your spiritual journey, you are welcome here.

City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event details: The acclaimed new British drama MR.BURTON has its exclusive U.S. engagement at the Mystic Theater, located at 240 Commercial Street in downtown Nevada City. Based on a true story, the movie stars Harry Lawtey as Richard Jenkins, an intelligent and impassioned young man growing up in a dysfunctional family in a tiny Welsh mining village who is taken under the wing by his high school drama teacher, Mr. Burton (Toby Jones), who cultivates the lad's natural creative gifts and molds him into the superb actor known to the world today as "Richard Burton." Filmed on location in Wales and London, MR. BURTON (rated PG) shows nightly at 7:30 pm from Friday, Sept. 19 through Monday, Sept. 22, with special 4 pm weekend matinees on Sept. 20-21. More information can be obtained by calling the Mystic Theater at 530-755-6677..

item.title: Playwriting Group
item.description:
Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.)
Wednesday, October 8, 2025, 4:30 – 6:30pm



All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

item.title: Macrame a Plant Hanger
item.description:
The Curious Forge
13024 Bitney Springs Rd Bld 9
Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 9, 2025, 10am – 12pm

Macrame for Beginners, no experience is needed!

Come relax and create your own beautiful plant hanger! You will learn some of the history behind this historical art while learning basic knots and techniques using soft 100% cotton cords. Macrame is an ancient and calming hands-on art, consisting of a beautiful variety of half knot and square knot patterns. It’s as easy as tying your shoe!

Using soft, 100% cotton cord, you’ll be guided step-by-step through essential knots such as:
• Half Knot
• Square Knot
• Spiral (Repeating Half Knot)
• Gathering Knot

Whether you’re brand new to macramé or looking for a fun refresher, this class is a perfect introduction.

Price: $ 45 ($35 + $10 materials)

Ages: Adults and Teens 12+

Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 6 minimum/12 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

Please note: All classes require a minimum number of participants and may be rescheduled if that minimum is not met. If this happens, we’ll let you know in advance and work with you to get you into the next available class.

item.title: Large Form Ceramic and Underwater Photography Gallery Pop-Up
item.description:
The Parsonage Annex - 425 Broad St, Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 9, 2025, 11am – 4pm

Type of Event: Visual Art / Gallery
City/Area: Nevada City
Price: Free
Age range: All Ages
Event details: After receiving a bachelor's degree in Communication in 2017 at the University of Cincinnati, Leila signed up for pottery classes at a local studio and quickly transitioned from student to member, and eventually Artist in Residence. In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Her desire to create functional tableware and everyday vessels for the home is much in part influenced by her upbringing as a first generation Palestinian American who grew up gathering around food and family. In 2020, Leila moved into her first private studio where she transitioned to working as a full-time artist. In August of 2021, she, her partner, and their dog Libby moved across the country to Nevada City, California to further pursue their respective pottery and carpentry dreams and to be closer to the surroundings that inspire their creations most. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. Her want is for women and couples to experience something new in front of the camera. An experience that connects people with their bodies. That inspires self-confidence and personal trust. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. Connection to self, to the ones people care about most, to the essence and harmony of nature that is all around us.

item.title: Explore History and Heritage at the North Star House – Twice Monthly Tours Now Offered
item.description:
12075 Auburn Rd. Grass Valley, CA 95949
Thursday, October 9, 2025, 1 – 3pm



Discover the rich history and natural beauty of the North Star House during our public tours, now held every 2nd and 4th Thursday from 1:00 to 3:00 PM. This Julia Morgan-designed masterpiece invites visitors to explore its storied architecture, remarkable grounds, and vibrant role in Nevada County’s past and present.



Once the home of author and illustrator Mary Hallock Foote and North Star Mine Superintendent Arthur De Wint Foote, the North Star House was built as a gathering space for engineers, writers, and visionaries of the time. Over a century later, it's being lovingly brought back to life by a team of volunteers, craftsmen, and historians who believe in preserving its legacy for generations to come.



On the tour, you’ll walk through spaces that have been beautifully restored and others still mid-transformation, offering a rare behind-the-scenes look at historic preservation in action. From intricate stonework to original fireplaces, each corner of the house tells a story.



The tour also includes a chance to explore the Heritage Garden, where volunteers have carefully brought back native and heirloom plants that reflect the site’s early 20th-century roots. It’s a peaceful spot to pause, take in the view, and see firsthand how the property continues to grow.



No RSVP is needed, just come by during tour hours. Admission is free, though donations are always welcome and go directly toward keeping this community treasure alive.



Address: 12075 Auburn Rd, Grass Valley

Dates: 2nd & 4th Thursdays

Time: 1–3 PM (drop in anytime)

item.title: Oil & Acrylic Painting: A Guided Exploration with Chappy
item.description:
The Curious Forge
13024 Bitney Springs Rd
Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 9, 2025, 4 – 7pm

Oil & Acrylic Adventures: Your Subject, Your Style. In-depth personalized painting instruction on the subject matter of your choice.
Class Details:

Schedule: Four 3-hour sessions (12 hours total)
Cost: $198 for the public
Level: Suitable for beginners and experienced painters

Class Overview

Explore the art of painting in this fun and immersive four-session workshop! Using a simple and effective four-step approach, you’ll learn how to bring any subject to life—whether it’s a portrait, a wildflower-filled landscape, or a captivating still life. Over four weeks, you’ll gain a broader understanding of composition, color, value, and texture, ending the series with a completed painting you’re proud of. Guided by Chappy, you’ll receive personalized instruction tailored to your creative vision.
What You’ll Learn:

A straightforward four-step painting process
Principles of composition, color, value, and texture
How to translate your chosen subject into a successful painting

What to Bring:

Any opaque medium and matching brushes (Don’t buy any new paints until after you attend the first class and Chappy will review supplies with you)
Two painting surfaces (canvas, paper, board, etc.)
Several photos of your subject (5×7 or larger hard copy recommended or an iPad)
A painting smock or old clothes
If you do not have any painting supplies yet, please contact spark@thecuriousforge.org for a list of supplies needed to start.

Additional Information:

Class Size: Minimum 4, Maximum 6 participants
Registration: Pre-registration required

Using a simple and effective four-step approach, you’ll learn how to bring any subject to life—whether it’s a portrait, a wildflower-filled landscape, or a captivating still life. Over four weeks, you’ll gain a broader understanding of composition, color, value, and texture, ending the series with a completed painting you’re proud of. Guided by Chappy, you’ll receive personalized instruction tailored to your creative vision., What You’ll Learn:, A straightforward four-step painting process, Principles of composition, color, value, and texture, How to translate your chosen subject into a successful painting, What to Bring:, Any opaque medium and matching brushes (Don’t buy any new paints until after you attend the first class and Chappy will review supplies with you), Two painting surfaces (canvas, paper, board, etc.), Several photos of your subject (5×7 or larger hard copy recommended or an iPad), A painting smock or old clothes, If you do not have any painting supplies yet, please contact spark@thecuriousforge.org for a list of supplies needed to start., Additional Information:, Class Size: Minimum 4, Maximum 6 participants, Registration: Pre-registration required
More info: thecuriousforge.org…

item.title: Large Form Ceramic and Underwater Photography Gallery Pop-Up
item.description:
The Parsonage Annex - 425 Broad St, Nevada City, CA 95959
Friday, October 10, 2025, 11am – 4pm

Type of Event: Visual Art / Gallery
City/Area: Nevada City
Price: Free
Age range: All Ages
Event details: After receiving a bachelor's degree in Communication in 2017 at the University of Cincinnati, Leila signed up for pottery classes at a local studio and quickly transitioned from student to member, and eventually Artist in Residence. In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Her desire to create functional tableware and everyday vessels for the home is much in part influenced by her upbringing as a first generation Palestinian American who grew up gathering around food and family. In 2020, Leila moved into her first private studio where she transitioned to working as a full-time artist. In August of 2021, she, her partner, and their dog Libby moved across the country to Nevada City, California to further pursue their respective pottery and carpentry dreams and to be closer to the surroundings that inspire their creations most. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. Her want is for women and couples to experience something new in front of the camera. An experience that connects people with their bodies. That inspires self-confidence and personal trust. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. Connection to self, to the ones people care about most, to the essence and harmony of nature that is all around us.

item.description:

Type of event: Art & Gallery

City/Area: Reno, NV
Online ticket: www.nevadaart.org…
Age range: All Ages
Event description: Join us for a screening of the films Petyarre and Atnangkere, two related short films both depicting the search by the artist Gloria Petyarre and her family for a cave that has great significance in the culture of her people. The filmmaker Viviana Petyarre, an Alyawarre filmmaker, shares personal and cultural stories connected to her family and their land. These short documentaries give a heartfelt look into the strength of family, culture, and connection to the land in Aboriginal Australia. Discussion to follow the screening with Senior Curator of Contemporary Art, Apsara DiQuinzio.

item.title: Six Ft. Swells Press 20th Anniversary Poetry Party and Performance
item.description:
The Wild Eye Pub
535 Mill St.
Grass Valley, CA 95945
Friday, October 10, 2025, 6:30 – 9pm



Infamous poetry press, Six Ft. Swells returns to Grass Valley for one night to celebrate their 20th anniversary as publishers with a party and poetry performance for the launch of their two new books: From the Top Shelf: a Six Ft. Swells Anthology, 2005-2025, and Three Poets Walk Into a Bar... by Todd Cirillo, Julie Valin and Matt Amott. 



​​​​​​​The event features performances by Todd Cirillo, Julie Valin, Matt Amott, plus special guests. They invite you to join the party!

Price: sliding scale donation by venue
Phone: (530) 446-6668
Email: julthepoet@gmail.com
Type of event: Literary Arts
Venue: Wild Eye Pub
City/Area: Grass Valley
Online ticket: Wild Eye Pub, Tickets
Age range: All Ages
Event description: Six Ft. Swells Press Returns to Grass Valley to Celebrate 20 Years, Infamous poetry press, Six Ft. Swells returns to Grass Valley for one night to celebrate their 20th anniversary as publishers with a party and poetry performance for the launch of their two new books: From the Top Shelf: a Six Ft. Swells Anthology, 2005-2025, and Three Poets Walk Into a Bar... by Todd Cirillo, Julie Valin and Matt Amott. , Three Poets Walk Into a Bar… is the first collection of all three  poets and co-founders of the press. The book includes new poems, essays and photographs. From the Top Shelf anthology represents the work of the poets from nineteen books the press has published over the years, from first time writers to internationally known poets. It raises a toast to poets they have admired, lost, and still love. Many of the poets are local such as Bill Gainer, Will Staple, Marilyn Souza, and more. , The press has a reputation for dynamic events, bringing the audience into the show by encouraging participation, creating a rowdy, fun, and celebratory atmosphere. They view poetry readings as an excuse for a party, a getting together for good times around great words. Their events have been described as closer to a 1982 Van Halen show than a poetry reading. The publishers wanted to not only celebrate the poets, but the community the press was born in., The event features performances by Todd Cirillo, Julie Valin, Matt Amott with local poets Will Staple and Marilyn Souza, plus San Francisco poet, Wiliam Taylor Jr. They invite you to join the party, Friday October 10th, 6:30p.m. at the Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill St. Grass Valley.  For information: facebook/sixftswells,  wildeyepub.com.
More info: www.sixftswellspress.com

Event details: After receiving a bachelor's degree in Communication in 2017 at the University of Cincinnati, Leila signed up for pottery classes at a local studio and quickly transitioned from student to member, and eventually Artist in Residence. In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Her desire to create functional tableware and everyday vessels for the home is much in part influenced by her upbringing as a first generation Palestinian American who grew up gathering around food and family. In 2020, Leila moved into her first private studio where she transitioned to working as a full-time artist. In August of 2021, she, her partner, and their dog Libby moved across the country to Nevada City, California to further pursue their respective pottery and carpentry dreams and to be closer to the surroundings that inspire their creations most. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. Her want is for women and couples to experience something new in front of the camera. An experience that connects people with their bodies. That inspires self-confidence and personal trust. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. Connection to self, to the ones people care about most, to the essence and harmony of nature that is all around us.

item.title: PAMBLO: Remembering a Forgotten Leader
item.description:
‘Uba Seo: Nisenan Arts & Culture
225 Broad Street, Nevada City, CA 95959
Saturday, October 11, 2025, 6 – 9:30pm



PAMBLO: Remembering a Forgotten Leader

Curated by Shelly Covert, Mira Clark & Ruth Chase



Opening Reception: October 11, 6–9:30 PM



On View: October 11, 2025 – November, 2026

Location: ‘Uba Seo: Nisenan Arts & Culture

225 Broad Street, Nevada City, CA 95959

Friday & Saturday: 11 AM – 6 PM

 

Price: FREE
Email: mira@chirpca.org
Type of event: Art & Gallery, Organizations and Facilities, Visual Arts
Venue: ‘Uba Seo: Nisenan Arts & Culture
Event location: Other
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event description: PAMBLO: Remembering a Forgotten Leader is the seventh exhibition at ‘Uba Seo: Nisenan Arts & Culture in downtown Nevada City., This powerful exhibition is part of CHIRP’s Visibility Through Art (VTA) initiative, which brings together artists and Tribal Culture Bearers to raise public awareness about the Nevada City Rancheria Nisenan Tribe., Focusing on Chief Pamblo—also known as Owly, Pamlo, and High Chief Toley—who lived from around 1830 to 1905, the exhibit honors his legacy and that of his descendants., Through educational panels, never-before-seen images, and significant cultural artifacts, visitors will learn about the Nisenan people’s enduring history before colonization, through the Gold Rush, and into the present. The exhibit also features contemporary artworks and a striking textile installation created by living Tribal members, descendants of Pamblo, and collaborating artists—celebrating cultural memory and resilience., Participating Nevada City Rancheria Nisenan Tribal Member Artists: Shelly Covert, Lorena Davis, Sarah Thomas, Cindy Buero, Debra Mcbrien, Saxon Thomas, Brittney Depew, Heidi Noel Native | Nisenan Special Guest Artists: Tiffany Adams Participating Artists: Maile Claire, Mekdela Maskal, Bishop Randall, FluxFlow Glass, and Miles Dearling,  
More info: www.facebook.com…

Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating, Genre: bluegrass, rock, reggae, singer-songwriter, Keller Williams, the genre-blurring multi-instrumentalist from Virginia, has built a loyal following with his signature solo looping shows and ever-evolving musical projects., Since his 1994 debut FREEK, Keller has released a steady stream of one-syllable-titled albums—each a unique sonic experiment spanning rock, funk, bluegrass, jazz, and what he dubs “acoustic dance music” (ADM)., Known for his improvisational live sets and playful originality, Keller keeps audiences guessing with every performance, whether solo or alongside collaborators like Keller & The Keels, Grateful Grass, and his latest ensemble, DeadPettyKellerGrass., Relentlessly inventive and refreshingly unconventional, Keller continues to tour clubs and festivals nationwide, delivering joyfully unpredictable musical experiences.

Event details: The acclaimed new British drama MR.BURTON has its exclusive U.S. engagement at the Mystic Theater, located at 240 Commercial Street in downtown Nevada City. Based on a true story, the movie stars Harry Lawtey as Richard Jenkins, an intelligent and impassioned young man growing up in a dysfunctional family in a tiny Welsh mining village who is taken under the wing by his high school drama teacher, Mr. Burton (Toby Jones), who cultivates the lad's natural creative gifts and molds him into the superb actor known to the world today as "Richard Burton." Filmed on location in Wales and London, MR. BURTON (rated PG) shows nightly at 7:30 pm from Friday, Sept. 19 through Monday, Sept. 22, with special 4 pm weekend matinees on Sept. 20-21. More information can be obtained by calling the Mystic Theater at 530-755-6677..

item.description:

13024 Bitney Springs Rd
Nevada City, CA 95959
Sunday, October 12, 2025, 12 – 3pm

Come in and make some Ceramic Garden Art with Bob Davis

Dive into the world of ceramics with Bob Davis in our Ceramic Garden Art class—no experience needed! Over a 3-class series, unleash your creativity as you learn to hand-build delightful Bird Houses, Garden Totems, or Bat Houses. Master the art of slab and coil building, explore pressing designs into clay, and get introduced to various glazing techniques. This workshop promises fun and inventive sessions where your imagination can soar:

Making Garden Art with Clay: A 3-hour session of demonstrations and hands-on crafting.
Decorating and Underglazing: Another 3-hour session to add color and life to your pieces, followed by bisque firing.
Final Glazing: A 3-hour session to complete your projects with glazing and under-glazing techniques.

Ages 16+

Rabbi David Azen from Congregation B’nai Harim at the Nevada County Jewish Community Center (NCJCC) invites you to join him for the 5h Annual Golf Tournament Fundraiser on Sunday, October 12 at 1 PM at the beautiful Lake Wildwood Golf Course in Penn Valley (which was voted as one of Nevada County’s Best Golf Course by the Union newspaper). All levels of golfers – men and women - are welcome! This “Scramble Format” tournament - with mulligans and miracle putts available at registration – features a $10,000 Hole-in-One Prize for up to three lucky golfers and other prizes! Your contribution of $135 will include green fees, golf cart, range balls, and dinner at Lake Wildwood’s beautiful club house. You can bring a foursome – or make new friends by joining a group. If you’ve never played at Lake Wildwood’s golf course, this is your chance! All proceeds from the tournament will be used to increase NCJCC community engagement by offering educational and charitable community events.This is a great opportunity to get involved in many ways. We are looking for golfers, sponsors, volunteers, and donations. To register for the tournament or to become a sponsor contact Darrell Goodin, Tournament Co-Chair at 925-963-0595 or captdarrell22@gmail.com. Please visit our website to learn more: ncjcc.org…. See you on the green!Current sponsors include:- $10,000 Hole-in-One Sponsors: AJA Video, Amethyst Medical Group, California Solar & Electric, MoPix Creative, Pro-Show, Ted Mehr Law Office, Tri Counties Bank- Special Prizes Hole in-One Sponsors: Miles Adler, Premier Flooring- Tee Sponsors: Ameriprise Financial, Bouchier-Pritchett Family Medicine, Caring at End of Life, Garrett Eckerling, M.D., Cohen Defense Group, Collins Property Management, Dr. Monte J. Smith, DDS, Grass Valley Provisions, Holiday Market, House of Print and Copy, Lake Wildwood Citizens Who Care, Mann Made Resources, Peter’s Drilling & Pump Service, REMax Gold/Jamie Barber, Sierra Heritage Realty, Soho Consultant, State Farm Insurance, Stucki Jewelers, Summit Nephrology, The Onyx Theatre, The Owl Tavern, Top Tech Automotive, Tree Walker, Wild Birds Unlimited, Dr. Robert D. Morgan DC Inc.
More info: ncjcc.org…

item.description:

535 Mill St

Sunday, October 12, 2025, 6 – 9pm



Wild Eye Pub is a family-friendly event venue, with a restaurant and bar: freshly crafted food from local & organic sources, full bar with regional brews, wines & spirits, and nightly events in a comfy 'supper club' style with an easy vibe.

This event is on our large dining room stage. Seating and service begins 1 hour ahead. We serve "supper club" style: Table service of food/drinks is (quietly) offered before & during the show.

Reservations are always recommended.

Price: Optional Cover Charge
Phone: (530) 446-6668
Email: rich.celio@icloud.com
Type of event: Music
City/Area: Grass Valley
Online ticket: This is not a ticketed event. You can leave a message for reservations by phone or email, 24/7. Our limited seating often fills before the day of the show.  Wildeye charges a $5-10 sliding scale cover fee.
Age range: All Ages
Event description: The house trio will be Al Feeney, keyboards; John Lace, bass, Karl Chelette, drums, MC and your host for the evening. Drinks and great food available.,          If you would like to sit in, bring charts if not readily available in fake books, vocalists need to have music, or know it, in their key and bring their own microphone. Guitarists could bring a small amp. You may play solo with the trio or add others to your combo. Bring a friend, tell a friend and help this great local jazz jam session grow!!! Hope to see you there!!, Note:  There will be a slight change of format starting Sunday because of the large number of musicians coming in to play. We will be changing to one song per person till we get through the signup list, then we will continue to repeat through the list again, in order, until we run out of time. This will ensure that musicians aren't waiting around for so long in order to play. Thanks for coming out to support out local jazz jam sessions!!!

item.title: From Beyond
item.description:
Nevada Theatre
401 Broad St
Nevada City, CA
Sunday, October 12, 2025, 7 – 9pm



FROM BEYOND - 10/12 - In our second set of Schlocktoberfest double features at the Nevada Theatre, we highlight the talents of Director Stuart Gordon, as well as actors Jeffrey Combs and Barbara Crampton.

Price: 10.00
Phone: 530-265 8262‬
Email: info@theonyxtheatre.com
Type of event: Film
Venue: Nevada Theatre
Event location: Nevada Theatre
City/Area: Nevada City
Online ticket: booking.theonyxtheatre.com…
Age range: Teens, Adult, Seniors
Event description: Two gloopy body horror adaptations of H.P. Lovecraft's short stories. Dr. Edward Pretorius, an acclaimed physicist, has perfected his newest invention: the Resonator, a machine that allows those near to it to glimpse life not visible to the naked eye. Imagining the discoveries he could make, Pretorius begins to go mad, much to the concern of his young assistant, Crawford Tillinghast (Combs). However, after the machine malfunctions during a highly sensitive experiment and Pretorius is found brutally murdered, Crawford is fingered as the primary suspect. Crawford, now confined to an asylum, becomes the ward of Dr. Katherine McMichaels (Crampton), who takes a special interest in his tales of the strange creatures able to be seen while the machine is operating and convinces him to help her rebuild the device, woefully unaware of the terrifying, hidden world she is about to enter.,  
More info: booking.theonyxtheatre.com…

Based on a true story, the movie stars Harry Lawtey as Richard Jenkins, an intelligent and impassioned young man growing up in a dysfunctional family in a tiny Welsh mining village who is taken under the wing by his high school drama teacher, Mr. Burton (Toby Jones), who cultivates the lad's natural creative gifts and molds him into the superb actor known to the world today as "Richard Burton." Filmed on location in Wales and London, MR. BURTON (rated PG) shows nightly at 7:30 pm from Friday, Sept. 19 through Monday, Sept. 22, with special 4 pm weekend matinees on Sept. 20-21. When he invents a reagent capable of reanimating deceased bodies, West and classmate Dan Cain (Bruce Abbott) begin testing the glowing green substance on fresh cadavers. As it turns out, the dead are unpredictable and hard to contain.

item.title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
item.description:
The Curious Forge
13024 Bitney Springs Rd
Nevada City, CA 95959
Monday, October 13, 2025, 5:30 – 8:30pm

Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing

Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity.

Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!
Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.
Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items.

Ages 14+

Price: $180

Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

item.title: African Drum & Dance
item.description:
325 Spring Street Nevada City CA
Tuesday, October 14, 2025, 4 – 6:30pm



For over 30 years Nevada County has offered this unique opportunity to learn music, song, and dance from African Diasporic disciplines. Drum class is offered from 4-5pm with Masters of their craft. It’s recommended to bring your own instrument. From 5-630pm dance class is guided by warm and welcoming artists! Warm up is about 30min- followed by steps and choreography according to specific rhythms. The class is well-paced and engaging, & quite energetic! All are welcome to join!

Price: $20 each Drum/Dance
Phone: 5304703053
Email: lisa.mangoblue@gmail.com
Type of event: Dance
Venue: Miners Foundry Cultural Center
Event location: Miners Foundry
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience. For more info or to join our email list contact Lisa @ Lisa.mangoblue@gmail.com

Event details: The Sierra Center for Spiritual Living is proud to host the Rise & Speak Experience, a transformative 7-week public speaking workshop designed to help participants uncover their life’s defining moments and craft messages that uplift, inspire, and educate.Created and facilitated by Mitch Austin, a certified Master Storyteller with over 15 years of public speaking experience, this immersive journey guides participants through a process of personal reflection, storytelling mastery, and stage presence. The program culminates in a live performance night where students share their heartfelt messages with a supportive audience.What Participants Will Gain:A powerful, personal message rooted in life experienceStorytelling techniques and public speaking skillsConfidence and tools to manage stage frightA sense of community and deep connectionA safe, affirming space for healing and growthEach participant receives one-on-one coaching with Mitch and completes guided homework to support message development. The final performance offers a chance to share their story with a loving and enthusiastic audience.Registration Required: To reserve your spot, email office@sierracenter.org or call (530) 274-1018. Space is limited to ensure personalized attention."I was so elevated. I knew it wasn’t heaven, but it had to be in the same zip code." — Kathy S., Rise & Speak graduateLet your story rise. Let your voice speak. Join us for the Rise & Speak Experience.Important Information:Please park in the rear of the Veteran’s Memorial building located at 255 S. Auburn Street, Grass Valley, and use the footpath to the Center. About Sierra Center for Spiritual Living:Sierra Center is a diverse and welcoming community. We engage in practices that uplift the spirit, deepen awareness and activate compassion for ourselves, each other, and the world. Wherever you are on your spiritual journey, you are welcome here.
More info: sierracenter.org…

City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event details: The acclaimed new British drama MR.BURTON has its exclusive U.S. engagement at the Mystic Theater, located at 240 Commercial Street in downtown Nevada City. Based on a true story, the movie stars Harry Lawtey as Richard Jenkins, an intelligent and impassioned young man growing up in a dysfunctional family in a tiny Welsh mining village who is taken under the wing by his high school drama teacher, Mr. Burton (Toby Jones), who cultivates the lad's natural creative gifts and molds him into the superb actor known to the world today as "Richard Burton." Filmed on location in Wales and London, MR. BURTON (rated PG) shows nightly at 7:30 pm from Friday, Sept. 19 through Monday, Sept. 22, with special 4 pm weekend matinees on Sept. 20-21. More information can be obtained by calling the Mystic Theater at 530-755-6677..

item.title: Playwrights Group
item.description:
Private residence in Grass Valley. Email Kimberly at marionsfirebykimberly@gmail.com
Wednesday, October 15, 2025, 4:30pm



Meet with fellow playwrights twice a month to discuss tools of the trade, playwriting tips, provide and receive feedback, and share in the process of creating plays or musicals for the stage. 

Price: 0
Phone: 7072929498
Email: marionsfirebykimberly@gmail.com
Type of event: Literary Arts, Theatre
Venue: Private Residence
Event location: Grass Valley
City/Area: Grass Valley
Age range: All Ages
Event description: All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going writers' group. We meet on the 1st and 3rd Weds of every month. On the 1st Weds one member of the group provides a brief presentation or leads a discussion on some aspect of playwriting. After the presentation/discussion, we'll do a brief check-in, and then spend the rest of our time writing in silence. and check-out at the end of our session. On the 3rd Weds, we read a play of one member of the group and provide feedback. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.
More info: www.facebook.com…

item.title: Large Form Ceramic and Underwater Photography Gallery Pop-Up
item.description:
The Parsonage Annex - 425 Broad St, Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 16, 2025, 11am – 4pm

Type of Event: Visual Art / Gallery
City/Area: Nevada City
Price: Free
Age range: All Ages
Event details: After receiving a bachelor's degree in Communication in 2017 at the University of Cincinnati, Leila signed up for pottery classes at a local studio and quickly transitioned from student to member, and eventually Artist in Residence. In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Her desire to create functional tableware and everyday vessels for the home is much in part influenced by her upbringing as a first generation Palestinian American who grew up gathering around food and family. In 2020, Leila moved into her first private studio where she transitioned to working as a full-time artist. In August of 2021, she, her partner, and their dog Libby moved across the country to Nevada City, California to further pursue their respective pottery and carpentry dreams and to be closer to the surroundings that inspire their creations most. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. Her want is for women and couples to experience something new in front of the camera. An experience that connects people with their bodies. That inspires self-confidence and personal trust. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. Connection to self, to the ones people care about most, to the essence and harmony of nature that is all around us.

item.title: Intro to Stained Glass – Level 1
item.description:
The Curious Forge
13024 Bitney Springs Rd bld 9
Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 16, 2025, 5 – 8pm



Experience the art of stained glass in this beginner-friendly workshop! Join us to craft a small suncatcher using vibrant glass pieces in this class with Charne Morris. No experience necessary—just bring your enthusiasm!

Price: $79
Phone: 530-446-2777
Email: spark@thecuriousforge.org
Type of event: Art & Gallery, Visual Arts, Workshop
Venue: The Curious Forge
City/Area: Nevada City
Online ticket: thecuriousforge.org…
Age range: All Ages
Event description: Intro to Stained Glass. Level 1 – Straight Cuts, Experience the art of stained glass in this beginner-friendly workshop! Join us to craft a small suncatcher using vibrant glass pieces in this class with Charne Morris. No experience necessary—just bring your enthusiasm!, This introductory class focuses on straight cuts and will teach you the basics of stained glass safety., Throughout this 3-hour class, you will learn pattern transfer, glass cutting, grinding, foiling, soldering, and polishing. You will go home with a finished project piece that is roughly 3.5” x 4”., A materials cost of $20 is required on the day. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., What You’ll Learn:, Basics of stained glass art, How glass behaves and the creation process, Selecting and cutting glass pieces, Creating a stained glass suncatcher using the copper foil method and soldering techniques, Details:, Duration: 3 hours, Price: $79 class fee + plus additional material fee $20 is required during class. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., Ages: Adults and 16+, Participants: Minimum of 3, maximum of 6 (Class will be rescheduled if minimum attendance is not met)  Please note: All classes require a minimum number of participants and may be rescheduled if that minimum is not met. If this happens, we’ll let you know in advance and work with you to get you into the next available class., Join us for this creative journey and leave with your own stunning stained glass suncatcher!
More info: thecuriousforge.org…

item.title: Creative Capital | Cultivating Community with ASiF - Artists’ Studio in the Foothills Exhibition
item.description:
Rood Center
950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City 95959
Friday, October 17, 2025, 8am – 5pm



Through this multi-media exhibition, Creative Capital highlights the importance of creative hubs as catalysts for commerce and social well-being. It takes a close look at how creative spaces serve as essential vehicles for developing and sustaining professional artists.

Type of event: Art & Gallery, Visual Arts
Venue: Eric Rood Administrative Center
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event description: By partnering with ASiF, this exhibition takes a behind-the-scenes look at just one of the many makers’ spaces that make Nevada County a thriving arts ecosystem—by providing access to a network of resources and relationships within the community. Celebrate ASiF’s community and learn more about the powerful impact these creative hubs have within our Cultural Districts, east and west., Art in Public Spaces is a program of Nevada County Arts Council, presented in partnership with the County of Nevada., Exhibition: September 12, 2025 - February 17, 2026, Opening Reception: Friday, September 19th at 4:30pm, Where: The Eric Rood Administrative Center - 950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City

In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. item.title: Speaker Series: Jerry Martini – How Many Miners Died in the Gold Mines?
item.description:
12075 Auburn Rd. Grass Valley CA 95949
Sunday, October 19, 2025, 2 – 3:30pm



How dangerous were Grass Valley’s gold mines? How many miners died? And what was the impact on families left behind? Many have asked these questions over the years and no one has given a definitive answer until now.

Type of Event: Community, Conference / Lecture / Workshop, History / Heritage
Event location: North Star House
City/Area: Grass Valley
Price: $10
Online ticket: www.northstarhouse.org…
Age range: All Ages
Event details: How dangerous were Grass Valley’s gold mines? How many miners died? And what was the impact on families left behind? Many have asked these questions over the years and no one has given a definitive answer until now.On Sunday, October 19 at 2 pm, historian Jerry Martini will present his exhaustive study, “Mining Fatalities in the Grass Valley Gold Mining District, 1851 – 1950” at the North Star House, 12075 Auburn Road, Grass Valley. Tickets are available for $10 at www.thenorthstarhouse.org or at the door while they last.In completing his study, Martini has drawn on a wide range of sources, including earlier compilations, government reports, historic newspapers, mortuary and cemetery records, genealogical websites and online sources including findagrave.org.the result is the most complete picture of local mine safety and an important update to information presented at local museums and state parks.And Martini’s study reveals more than statistics. He also tells the human stories of widows and orphans who lost their breadwinner in America’s industrial era and of a community which regularly coped with tragedy.To Martini, a Grass Valley native whose father was a miner, it’s a personal story. He calls himself “lucky to have been born and raised in Grass Valley.” He also says he was lucky to see his father walking home every night from the mine.At the presentation The History Mill, a research cooperative, will release its first publication, Martini’s study in a 60-page booklet giving both the statistics and stories. The booklet will sell for $10 with all proceeds going to support restoration work at North Star House.The North Star House Conservancy, which is hosting Martini’s talk, is dedicated to preserving the house designed by architect Julia Morgan as an historic and cultural gathering space. The History Mill is a group of citizen historians who meet weekly at the house to research, document and tell stories of the region once known as The Northern Mines and including the richest gold districts in California.For more information about the event see the North Star House website or call 530-477-7126. For information about The History Mill, including meeting times and projects, call Derek Cheeseman at 650-339-2173.
More info: www.northstarhouse.org…

item.title: American Brass Quintet presented by InConcert Sierra
item.description:
12889 Osborne Hill Road, Grass Valley, CA
Sunday, October 19, 2025, 2 – 4pm



The American Brass Quintet is internationally recognized as one of the premier brass ensembles worldwide. Founded in 1960 and with 65+ years of excellence, the ABQ has become renowned for redefining the brass quintet.

The ensemble has served as Ensemble-in-Residence at The Juilliard School since 1987 and at the Aspen Music Festival since 1970. They don’t just perform — they mentor the next generation of top-tier brass players. We’ll be hearing the very best of the best.

Type of Event: Music / Concert
Event location: Seventh Day Adventist Church
City/Area: Grass Valley
Price: $50-$5
Online ticket: www.simpletix.com…
Age range: All Ages
Event details: The American Brass Quintet, Tiago Linck trumpet, ∙ Brandon Ridenour, trumpet ∙ Eric Reed, horn ∙ Hillary Simms, trombone ∙John D. Rojak, bass trombone, October 19, 2025 ∙ 2pm with 1:15 pre-concert forum:, Hear the Brass That Changed Everything.  When the American Brass Quintet takes the stage, you’re not just hearing five extraordinary musicians—you’re witnessing the group that redefined what brass chamber music could be.  Founded in 1954 as the first brass quintet in the U.S., ABQ has been called “positively breathtaking” by The New York Times and praised as “this country’s most distinguished” by the American Record Guide. Their sound is bold, brilliant, and impossibly precise—and their impact on the chamber music world is unmatched.  With decades of residency at The Juilliard School and the Aspen Music Festival, ABQ brings not just performance, but purpose—designing programs that resonate with and delight audiences, commissioning groundbreaking works, and mentoring the next generation of brass virtuosos.  Don’t miss the chance to hear the quintet that brass musicians worldwide look to as the gold standard. , "It is quite impossible to overpraise the playing of the American Brass Quintet...they have everything...brilliance, attack, perfect ensemble and intonation, and a tone quality of unrivaled purity, range and power..."- The Telegraph
More info: www.inconcertsierra.org…

item.title: Speaker Series: Jerry Martini – How Many Miners Died in the Gold Mines?
item.description:
North Star House - 12075 Auburn Rd. Grass Valley CA 95949
Sunday, October 19, 2025, 2 – 3:30pm

How dangerous were Grass Valley’s gold mines? How many miners died? And what was the impact on families left behind? Many have asked these questions over the years and no one has given a definitive answer until now.


On Sunday, October 19 at 2 pm, historian Jerry Martini will present his exhaustive study, “Mining Fatalities in the Grass Valley Gold Mining District, 1851 – 1950” at the North Star House, 12075 Auburn Road, Grass Valley. Tickets are available for $10 at www.thenorthstarhouse.org or at the door while they last.


In completing his study, Martini has drawn on a wide range of sources, including earlier compilations, government reports, historic newspapers, mortuary and cemetery records, genealogical websites and online sources including Findagrave.org.


The result is the most complete picture of local mine safety and an important update to information presented at local museums and state parks.

And Martini’s study reveals more than statistics. He also tells the human stories of widows and orphans who lost their breadwinner in America’s industrial era and of a community which regularly coped with tragedy.


To Martini, a Grass Valley native whose father was a miner, it’s a personal story. He calls himself “lucky to have been born and raised in Grass Valley.” He also says he was lucky to see his father walking home every night from the mine.


At the presentation The History Mill, a research cooperative, will release its first publication, Martini’s study in a 60-page booklet giving both the statistics and stories. The booklet will sell for $10 with all proceeds going to support restoration work at North Star House.


The North Star House Conservancy, which is hosting Martini’s talk, is dedicated to preserving the house designed by architect Julia Morgan as an historic and cultural gathering space. The History Mill is a group of citizen historians who meet weekly at the house to research, document and tell stories of the region once known as The Northern Mines and including the richest gold districts in California.


For more information about the event see the North Star House website or call 530-477-7126. For information about The History Mill, including meeting times and projects, call Derek Cheeseman at 650-339-2173.

Type of Event: Conference / Lecture / Workshop, History / Heritage
Event location: North Star House
City/Area: Grass Valley
Price: $10
Online ticket: www.northstarhouse.org…
Age range: All Ages
Event details: Join the Nevada County Magicians Guild on Friday, November 7th, or Saturday, November 8th from 7–9 PM for an unforgettable evening of mystery, illusion, and artistry at the historic North Star House. This event showcase features some of the region’s most talented magicians, performing in the intimate, Julia Morgan–designed venue where every seat feels close to the magic. Whether you’re a lifelong fan or seeing live magic for the first time, this performance promises delight, surprise, and plenty of “how did they do that?!” moments. Tickets are $15 and are only available in advance. The show is intended for audiences ages 10+.
More info: www.northstarhouse.org…

item.title: The Acclaimed New British Drama MR> BURTON Shows at the Mystic Theater!
item.description:
Mystic Theater
240 Commercial St.
Nevada City
Sunday, October 19, 2025, 7:30 – 9:30pm



"A HEARTWARMING TALE OF TRIUMPH AGAINST ADVERSITY" Screen International

Type of Event: Theatre / Film
Other location: Mystic Theater
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event details: The acclaimed new British drama MR.BURTON has its exclusive U.S. engagement at the Mystic Theater, located at 240 Commercial Street in downtown Nevada City. Based on a true story, the movie stars Harry Lawtey as Richard Jenkins, an intelligent and impassioned young man growing up in a dysfunctional family in a tiny Welsh mining village who is taken under the wing by his high school drama teacher, Mr. Burton (Toby Jones), who cultivates the lad's natural creative gifts and molds him into the superb actor known to the world today as "Richard Burton." Filmed on location in Wales and London, MR. BURTON (rated PG) shows nightly at 7:30 pm from Friday, Sept. 19 through Monday, Sept. 22, with special 4 pm weekend matinees on Sept. 20-21. More information can be obtained by calling the Mystic Theater at 530-755-6677..

item.title: Nevada City Winery Gallery - Richard Swayze "paintings and drawings"
item.description:
Nevada City Winery
Monday, October 20, 2025, 12 – 4pm



The paintings in this exhibit speak mountain language fluently. It is a silent language coming from study, personal experience, love and respect. His drawings are a study in precision.

Type of Event: Visual Art / Gallery
Event location: Nevada City Winery
City/Area: Nevada City
Price: free
Age range: All Ages
Event details: In both his paintings and drawings Swayze speaks of observation and stillness, while celebrating exhilaration, oddities and artifacts offering us the opportunity to ponder our and imprints smallness against the earth’s grandeur.This is Swayze’s third solo show at the Nevada City Winery Gallery and runs through November 17.
More info: www.ncwinery.com…

item.title: Christone "Kingfish" Ingram
item.description:
314 W Main Street, Grass Valley, CA
Monday, October 20, 2025, 7 – 9pm



Price: $40-$95
Phone: 530-274-8384
Email: boxoffice@thecenterforthearts.org
Type of event: Music
Venue: The Center for the Arts
Event location: Center for the Arts
City/Area: Grass Valley
Online ticket: thecenterforthearts.my.salesforce-sites.com…
Age range: All Ages
Event description: GRAMMY-winning guitarist, vocalist and songwriter Christone “Kingfish” Ingram has quickly become the defining blues voice of his generation., From his hometown of Clarksdale, Mississippi to stages around the globe, the young blues star has already headlined multiple U.S. and European tours, and amazed fans in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Canada and India. Selected in summer 2022 to open for The Rolling Stones in London’s Hyde Park, Kingfish has also performed and toured with friends including Vampire Weekend, Jason Isbell, Steve Miller and Buddy Guy, a mentor of his, with whom he appeared on Austin City Limits., Since he burst onto the scene in 2019, Ingram has been nominated for 12 Blues Music Awards and won them all. Rolling Stone declared, “Kingfish is one of the most exciting young guitarists in years, with a sound that encompasses B.B. King, Jimi Hendrix and Prince.” In September 2023, Kingfish released his jaw-dropping, GRAMMY-nominated, third album, Live In London. Recorded on June 6, 2023, in front of a sweaty, sold-out, standing-room-only crowd at the famous UK club, The Garage, Live In London is the guitar-driven live album Kingfish’s fans around the world have been clamoring for since they first watched him perform as a teenager on YouTube., Sparked by his non-stop touring, writing and recording schedule, Kingfish’s natural talent just keeps growing. With his jaw-dropping guitar playing and his reach-out-and-grab-you-by-the-collar vocals, he performs every song with unmatched passion and precision. To see him live in person is an onstage snapshot of the young singer, songwriter and guitarist creating musical, magic in real time, leaving his listeners spellbound and always wanting more.

item.title: African Drum & Dance
item.description:
325 Spring Street Nevada City CA
Tuesday, October 21, 2025, 4 – 6:30pm



For over 30 years Nevada County has offered this unique opportunity to learn music, song, and dance from African Diasporic disciplines. Drum class is offered from 4-5pm with Masters of their craft. It’s recommended to bring your own instrument. From 5-630pm dance class is guided by warm and welcoming artists! Warm up is about 30min- followed by steps and choreography according to specific rhythms. The class is well-paced and engaging, & quite energetic! All are welcome to join!

Price: $20 each Drum/Dance
Phone: 5304703053
Email: lisa.mangoblue@gmail.com
Type of event: Dance
Venue: Miners Foundry Cultural Center
Event location: Miners Foundry
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience. For more info or to join our email list contact Lisa @ Lisa.mangoblue@gmail.com
More info: www.facebook.com…

item.title: The Rise & Speak Experience
item.description:
119 Florence Ave.
Grass Valley, CA 95945
Tuesday, October 21, 2025, 6 – 8:30pm



Are you ready to turn your life story into a message that moves hearts and minds?

Type of Event: Community, Conference / Lecture / Workshop
Other location: Sierra Center for Spiritual Living
City/Area: Grass Valley
Price: $260 (payment plans available), $60 deposit required to hold your spot
Age range: Adult
Event details: The Sierra Center for Spiritual Living is proud to host the Rise & Speak Experience, a transformative 7-week public speaking workshop designed to help participants uncover their life’s defining moments and craft messages that uplift, inspire, and educate.Created and facilitated by Mitch Austin, a certified Master Storyteller with over 15 years of public speaking experience, this immersive journey guides participants through a process of personal reflection, storytelling mastery, and stage presence. The program culminates in a live performance night where students share their heartfelt messages with a supportive audience.What Participants Will Gain:A powerful, personal message rooted in life experienceStorytelling techniques and public speaking skillsConfidence and tools to manage stage frightA sense of community and deep connectionA safe, affirming space for healing and growthEach participant receives one-on-one coaching with Mitch and completes guided homework to support message development. The final performance offers a chance to share their story with a loving and enthusiastic audience.Registration Required: To reserve your spot, email office@sierracenter.org or call (530) 274-1018. Space is limited to ensure personalized attention."I was so elevated. I knew it wasn’t heaven, but it had to be in the same zip code." — Kathy S., Rise & Speak graduateLet your story rise. Let your voice speak. Join us for the Rise & Speak Experience.Important Information:Please park in the rear of the Veteran’s Memorial building located at 255 S. Auburn Street, Grass Valley, and use the footpath to the Center. About Sierra Center for Spiritual Living:Sierra Center is a diverse and welcoming community. We engage in practices that uplift the spirit, deepen awareness and activate compassion for ourselves, each other, and the world. Wherever you are on your spiritual journey, you are welcome here.

item.title: Playwriting Group
item.description:
Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.)
Wednesday, October 22, 2025, 4:30 – 6:30pm



All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

item.title: Large Form Ceramic and Underwater Photography Gallery Pop-Up
item.description:
The Parsonage Annex - 425 Broad St, Nevada City, CA 95959
Thursday, October 23, 2025, 11am – 4pm

Type of Event: Visual Art / Gallery
City/Area: Nevada City
Price: Free
Age range: All Ages
Event details: After receiving a bachelor's degree in Communication in 2017 at the University of Cincinnati, Leila signed up for pottery classes at a local studio and quickly transitioned from student to member, and eventually Artist in Residence. In 2019 she founded Tierra Madera, meaning earth and wood, with the hopes of paying homage to the foundational elements of ceramics that inspire her throughout this craft. Her desire to create functional tableware and everyday vessels for the home is much in part influenced by her upbringing as a first generation Palestinian American who grew up gathering around food and family. In 2020, Leila moved into her first private studio where she transitioned to working as a full-time artist. In August of 2021, she, her partner, and their dog Libby moved across the country to Nevada City, California to further pursue their respective pottery and carpentry dreams and to be closer to the surroundings that inspire their creations most. Jessie McCall believes in telling our stories, through conversation, through art, through the way we choose to move through this life. She believes everyone deserves to feel like art. Her want is for women and couples to experience something new in front of the camera. An experience that connects people with their bodies. That inspires self-confidence and personal trust. That and, it’s just plain fun. Anyone can be art. Every body is beautiful and capable. Jessie's life mission is to inspire connection. Connection to self, to the ones people care about most, to the essence and harmony of nature that is all around us.

item.title: The Altar Show: Renewal and Remembrance
item.description:
The Granucci Gallery
314 W. Main Street
Grass Valley, CA
Thursday, October 23, 2025, 4 – 5pm



Price: Free
Type of event: Art & Gallery
Venue: Granucci Gallery
Event location: Center for the Arts
City/Area: Grass Valley
Online ticket: thecenterforthearts.my.salesforce-sites.com…
Age range: All Ages
Event description: The first “Altar Show in Nevada County” took place in 1997, inspired by the Sacramento art show, “Altares del Mundo.” Based on Indo-Hispanic “Dia de los Muertos” traditions, artists created beautiful altars to honor beloved people who had passed on. The show was so powerful for both altaristas and viewers that it has become an annual event with up to sixty altars., The altars have evolved to include contemporary three-dimensional art with diverse topics, techniques, and media, as well as memorials in the historic tradition., Each show also includes a “community altar”, where visitors may participate by leaving personal notes, photos and mementos. The show does not charge admission but tax-deductible contributions are welcome as the show is self-supporting., Join us to celebrate and reaffirm the human experience. We hope you discover in our altars, as we do when we create them, a sense of healing, solace, joy, insight, relief, refreshment, renewal – perhaps even truth., Our Mission Statement, “The Altar Show: Renewal & Remembrance is a community-based non-profit organization that provides a free annual exhibition originally inspired by Day of The Dead that involves and educates the community while providing a safe place to renew and remember in a respectful and safe space.”, The Altar Show is administered by a Board of Directors.,  ,  , The Granucci Gallery at The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street • Grass Valley, CA, Art Opening: Thursday, October 23, 2025 • 5 - 7pm , Exhibition Dates: October 23, 2025- November 7, 2025

item.title: Creative Capital | Cultivating Community with ASiF - Artists’ Studio in the Foothills Exhibition
item.description:
Rood Center
950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City 95959
Friday, October 24, 2025, 8am – 5pm



Through this multi-media exhibition, Creative Capital highlights the importance of creative hubs as catalysts for commerce and social well-being. It takes a close look at how creative spaces serve as essential vehicles for developing and sustaining professional artists.

Type of event: Art & Gallery, Visual Arts
Venue: Eric Rood Administrative Center
City/Area: Nevada City
Age range: All Ages
Event description: By partnering with ASiF, this exhibition takes a behind-the-scenes look at just one of the many makers’ spaces that make Nevada County a thriving arts ecosystem—by providing access to a network of resources and relationships within the community. Celebrate ASiF’s community and learn more about the powerful impact these creative hubs have within our Cultural Districts, east and west., Art in Public Spaces is a program of Nevada County Arts Council, presented in partnership with the County of Nevada., Exhibition: September 12, 2025 - February 17, 2026, Opening Reception: Friday, September 19th at 4:30pm, Where: The Eric Rood Administrative Center - 950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City
